Class dom.session.BaseComponent 

java.lang.Object
    |
    +----dom.session.BaseComponent
Subclasses:
BaseContainable, BaseContainer
public class BaseComponent
extends java.lang.Object
Base class for all components (e.g. BaseContainer, BaseContainable) This base class implements the Component interface, and provides basic services for all components, like facet management, and etc.

Author:
Scott Lewis
See Also:
ComponentDObject
Source Code:
BaseComponent.java

Constructor Detail

BaseComponent

public BaseComponent(ComponentDObject owner,
                     java.lang.String identifier)
Constructor for BaseComponent. All components must have a non-null ComponentDObject owner, and a non-null string identifier. The following constructor guarantees this.
Parameters:
owner - the ComponentDObject owner of this component
identifier - the String identifier, that must be unique within the given ComponentDObject for identifying this component
Method Detail

getIdentifier

public final java.lang.String getIdentifier()
Get the String identifier for this BaseComponent. It is the ComponentDObject owner's responsibility for making sure that what this method returns is unique within that ComponentDObject

getOwner

public final ComponentDObject getOwner()
Get the ComponentDObject owner of this component.
Returns:
ComponentDObject owner of this component.

cleanUpFacetsWhenDObjectGone

public final void cleanUpFacetsWhenDObjectGone(DObjectID id)
Method called by ComponentDObject code to allow us to clean up our facet cache and myDeliveredFacet entries when a given DObjectID has gone away. This is called by ComponentDObject.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID that has gone away

handleDObjectGone

public void handleDObjectGone(DObjectID id)
Handle the departure of the DObject identified by the id parameter. This is called for us by the ComponentDObject.notifyComponentsOfDeactivation, which is called in response to the departure of the DObject identified by the given DObjectID. In response to this, for the BaseContainer class, we assume that if we contain the given DObject, that we should *remove* it from our set of contained DObjects. If subclasses wish, they may override this behavior, and do something else in response to this message, BUT they cannot assume that any facets they might be holding onto that belong to this id are still valid.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the departing DObject

getFacetForComponent

public final DObjectFacet getFacetForComponent(DObjectID requestor,
                                               java.io.Serializable data)
Get a DObjectFacet to this BaseComponent's functionality, intended for the given requestor. This is called by the ComponentDObject when it wishes to provide access to the functionality exposed by this Component to the *given* DObject.
Parameters:
requestor - the DObjectID of the other this facet will be delivered to
data - any Serializable data that we wish to require as part of the information required of the requested for facet granting
Returns:
DObjectFacet that we wish to provide to the requestor identified by the first parameter. May be null. In the case of this root class implementation, null is always returned. Subclasses may override to get desired behavior.

addDeliveredFacet

public final void addDeliveredFacet(DObjectID id,
                                    DObjectFacet aFacet)
Add the given facet to the Hashtable of facets that we have delivered to other DObjects. These are facets to *our* functionality, which we have to clean up on if the receiver of the DObjectFacet goes away.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the receiver of the given facet
aFacet - the facet that we are giving up to id

getDeliveredFacet

public final DObjectFacet getDeliveredFacet(DObjectID id)
Get a facet to the other that we have already delivered.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the receiver of the facet
Returns:
DObjectFacet the facet we have already given out to id, if found. If not found, null.

revokeAndRemoveDeliveredFacet

public final void revokeAndRemoveDeliveredFacet(DObjectID id)
Remove any facets that we have delivered to id specified by parameter. That is, if we have delivered any facets to our functionality to the given id, then revoke any such facet, and then remove it from our Hashtable of delivered facets
Parameters:
id - remove any/all facets associated with this id

createNewFacetForID

public DObjectFacet createNewFacetForID(DObjectID requestor,
                                        java.io.Serializable data)
Create a new instance of a facet for delivery to the DObject identified by the id parameter. This default implementation always returns null, which means that no facet is provided. Subclasses will want to override this to deliver facets to target DObjects as appropriate. The data parameter is present so that arbitrary data associated with the request can be passed into this method, so it can make the appropriate judgment about whether a facet should be provided.
Parameters:
requestor - the DObjectID of the requestor DObject
data - any Serializable data required

checkFacetForCache

public boolean checkFacetForCache(DObjectFacet aFacet)
Check given facet for addition to our facet cache. This is called by the ComponentDObject.notifyComponentsOfFacet method. This method allows the code in this component to decide whether it is interested in caching the facet that has been provided to the owner DObject, potentially for later use. If this method returns true, then the facet is added to our cache via the addFacetToCache method. If false, the facet is ignored by this component. This implementation of this method always returns false, indicating that it is not interested in any facets. Subclasses can override this functionality as desired.
Parameters:
aFacet - the DObjectFacet that we are entitled to examine
Returns:
true if the given DObjectFacet should be cached, false otherwise

addFacetToCache

public final void addFacetToCache(DObjectFacet aFacet) throws NullFacetException
Add given DObjectFacet to the cache maintained by this BaseComponent.
Parameters:
aFacet - the DObjectFacet to add to the cache
Throws:
NullFacetException - is thrown if facet provided is null or has been revoked

removeFacetFromCache

public final void removeFacetFromCache(DObjectID id)
Remove the DObjectFacet associated with the given id from our facet cache
Parameters:
id - the DObject id of the facet to remove

getFacetForID

public final DObjectFacet getFacetForID(DObjectID id) throws NullFacetException
Get the DObjectFacet associated with the given id from our facet cache. Will return null if DObjectFacet for given id does not exist in this Component's facet cache.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of associated with the DObjectFacet we are looking for
Throws:
NullFacetException - thrown if facet has been revoked

getMyID

protected final DObjectID getMyID()
Get the DObjectID for the owner ComponentDObject of this BaseContainer component.
Returns:
DObjectID that is the id for our owner

isClient

protected final boolean isClient()
Determine whether our DObject owner is currently a client, or host.
Returns:
true if we are a client, false if host

getStateForClient

protected java.io.Serializable getStateForClient(SessionViewID id)
Get state of this component for delivery to new client. The resulting object must implement the Serializable interface, as it will be sent over the wire to the remote client for initialization.
Parameters:
id - the SessionViewID of the view where the client is being constructed
Returns:
the Serializable object that contains the state to be sent to the new client. This object will be passed into the constructor of the remote client (last parameter) during the construction of the instance, and then passed to the setInitialState method
See Also:
loadDObject, LoadingDObject, setInitialState

setInitialState

protected void setInitialState(java.io.Serializable params)
Set initial state for this component. This method is called inside the constructor for the DObject instance, and is passed the Serializable last parameter. For this superclass version of the component, the implementation is to ignore the client state, because the above implementation of 'getStateForClient' simply provides null. Subclasses that override this method should also appropriately override the 'BaseComponent.getStateForClient' method.
Parameters:
params - the Serializable object that is passed to this component upon construction. For this superclass, the value is expected to be null.
See Also:
getStateForClient

debug

public void debug(java.lang.String aString)
Send string to debug output. For now, System, eventually some more sophisticated debugging support.
Parameters:
aString - the String to print out
